p: Previous studies have used a mixture design in order to achieve the best antioxidant mixture. Higher synergistic results have recently been published by Calderón-Oliver et al. (2016); the authors found synergistic effects in the range: 16.5–45.8%. A study on the application of a mixture design for optimal antioxidant activity of EO mixtures has recently been published, which analyzed Ocimum basilicum L., Origanum majorana L. and Rosmarinus officinalis L. ( Baj et al., 2018). The percentages of synergy found were in the range of 6.6–57.2%. Additional effects of EO mixtures have been reported, including the synergistic antibacterial effects of EO mixtures using Origanum compactum L., O. majorana and Thymus serpyllum L. ( Ouedrhiri et al., 2016).
